result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Dutch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate Vunerable Adult Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.123(10).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegal drugs or alcohol.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with M.D.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
AODA assessment and compliance with treatment. Random UA's.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Dutch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard J Dutch in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, and defense.    
Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit of 0 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months, with the following conditions:

- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- Random UA's.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- No contact with M.D.
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Richard J Dutch not in court, in custody.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Plaisted has received discovery but not an offer.  Atty. Plaisted requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Richard J Dutch not in court, in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in court for status. Defense requests an adjournment for reasons stated on the record. Case adjourned to Br 01.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with MD
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard J Dutch in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Richard J Dutch in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard J Dutch appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
